Key Match Events: New Zealand bowled Sri Lanka out for 171
Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra combined for 86 runs
Glenn Phillips sealed the deal with a fizzing four
Post-Match Reflections: The result means New Zealand have all but secured their place in the semi-finals with India, South Africa and Australia
Miscellaneous Highlights: For Sri Lanka, the defeat was the seventh from their nine matches, bringing a disappointing campaign to an end and leaving them in jeopardy of missing out on qualification for the 2025 Champions Trophy
Others: New Zealand ended their four-match losing run in style
The Black Caps did the damage with the ball before easily chasing down the 172-run target in less than 24 overs
